decision_conditions: <p>The existing pebbledash shall be removed with hand tools, or tools held in the hand only.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the underlying brickwork is not unduly damaged by the removal of the pebbledash.</p>

The new windows and doors hereby approved shall have a narrow glazed profile with a maximum width of 12mm (4mm glass, 4mm space, 4mm glass), and glazing bars shall be integral and not adhered to the surface of the glass.


REASON: To preserve the character and appearance of the host building and the Shacklewell Green Conservation Area.

The external render hereby permitted shall not be installed until full details, including sections, of the render have been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority.


The details shall include details of how thermal bridging around openings in the elevations will be avoided.


REASON: To preserve the character and appearance of the host building and the Shacklewell Green Conservation Area and to ensure that suitable insulation is provided.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
description: Removal of pebbledash from rear elevation and rear projection and replacement with painted insulating render; replacement of ground floor rear window with door; replacement of rear windows with timber framed windows; replacement of window with a door in side elevation of rear projection
